file_content.text: Rest assured, I shall notify you of my brilliant success as soon as this blasted machine finishes collating my data.
I knew it. I knew it. I knew you'd return victorious!
See, BT-9, that could be you striding confidently back to my praise.
Yes, master, I will always regret what could have been.
Now, my illustrious hero--my research.
This is everything I could find.
Here you go.
I can't wait to confirm my theor--oh blast it all!
These pages are out of order! It'll take weeks for my assistant to collate the data.
Oh, it would be my pleasure, master.
Eager to help once the hard work has been done--fair-weather scientist.
You've all done a great service for Tatooine today. Thank you.
Well, this was an unexpected setback, but you have performed admirably, my friend.
I think you owe me something.
You... you expect to be paid? What about the betterment of society? The greater good?
Oh well, I suppose you deserve something for your trouble.
Please accept this as a token of my gratitude. Good day.
I'm keeping it.
Y--you mean to steal my research? But that's my only hope of winning back the research committee's good graces.
Here, please, this is everything I have. Take it. Just don't rob me of my redemption!
If it means that much to you. Just keep it.
Okay, fine.
Thank you. Thank you. Now I must review my findings. Good day.
We're finished here.
This was a small price to pay.
Come, BT-9, I'm afraid we're going to have to hock your legs to pay for that.
What? But--but, master....
You really must hurry! There is no telling what those barbarians are doing to my equipment.
What luck! Excuse me, passersby, if I might impose....
Ah! Visual reinforcement. Look here, BT-9, members of the Jedi Order certainly remember their oaths.
Exceptional timing! This member of the Republic armed forces certainly knows a thing or two about duty.
You look like the worldly sort. I'm sure you'd do.
Excuse me, might I impose on you for a moment?
I am Fez Burba, scientist-notary of the Republic and planetary consult to the Galactic Senate.
Master, weren't you removed from that position?
Nonsense. The committee only reassigned me to Tatooine because they recognized this planet's dire need of my genius.
I was about to solve Tatooine's permanent drought problems when disaster struck my research; however, I think you could help.
Weren't you conducting research on Coruscant?
Don't I know you?
A bungling assistant cost me my grant, so I was forced to conduct my experiments somewhere more economical.
Since Coruscant was not in immediate danger, the research committee thought my talents would be better employed on Tatooine.
I'd like to hear more about this research before I agree to anything.
What sort of research?
I am hot on the heels of the most groundbreaking discovery in the history of Tatooine!
Okay, I'm listening.
Wonderful! You shall help make history today.
I'm too busy for this.
But this could change the face of Tatooine forever.
My research indicates that there could be massive reserves of water deep beneath the planet's surface.
Think of what that would mean to the people of Tatooine. Crops. Refreshments. Bathing.
Tatooine would be a very different place.
That is big.
Exactly. You see the value of such a discovery.
I'm skeptical; however, I would like to see this research of yours.
You've piqued my interest.
I'm sure I can put all your doubts to rest when I have my research returned.
It'd certainly improve morale.
A good bit.
I hardly think that captures the magnitude of this discovery.
I'd rather think about what it'd mean for me. You're talking about striking gold here.
Sounds promising.
I--I hardly think that profiting from such a discovery would be ethical.
I find that hard to believe.
There is no doubt in my mind that my research will prove true.
Now I know you're crazy.
It is the absolute truth, and I can prove it!
I was testing my theory when the Sand People raided my laboratory. I was about to send my remaining assistant to retrieve the results.
I assure you, master, it's impossible. There are still hordes of Sand People pillaging that region.
Given the lack of success by his predecessors, that would appear to be true.
How many assistants have you sent on this errand?
You've tried this already?
Oh about three... or was it four? No matter, their sacrifices will not be forgotten once Tatooine is covered in fertile growth.
I'll help.
Splendid! Your contribution to my research will be noted.
While you're out among those bloodthirsty savages, if you find my missing assistants, please retrieve them.
Much of my research data is stored in their memory cores.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Well then, BT-9, time for you to strike out into the wastes and show your mettle.
But--but, master, my motivators are not suited for undignified retreat.
I'm sorry, good citizen, but I really can't be bothered with common inquiries at this time.
